title: How To Find KDP Keywords Using Publisher Rocket - Low Content Kindle Publishing Keyword Research

tactics.name: Amazon Search Suggestions
tactics.description: Use Amazon's search bar and plugins to gather keyword ideas based on customer searches.
steps: Use incognito mode and set location to the US
Type keywords into Amazon search bar
Use Amazon Suggestion Expander plugin for additional terms
Check search volume with Keywords Anywhere plugin
caveats: Plugins may not work in incognito mode
source_quotes: Amazon practically tells you what their customers are searching for

tactics.name: Keyword Competition Analysis
tactics.description: Evaluate keyword competitiveness using search volume, competition rankings, and trend data to identify profitable niches.
steps: Analyze monthly search volume and competition scores
caveats: Seasonal keywords may show inflated short-term data
source_quotes: "coloring book for adults is up 14 whereas coloring book mandala is down 11"

tactics.name: Keyword Validation
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket's keyword search function to evaluate keyword competitiveness and profitability by cross-referencing Amazon data.
steps: Input keywords from Amazon and Publisher Rocket into the keyword search function
Assess keyword worthiness based on competition and search volume
caveats: Tool may fail to detect niche-specific long-tail keywords
source_quotes: take your list of keywords... pop them into here the keyword search function

heuristics.name: Search Volume Filter
heuristics.condition: If keyword search volume is below 1000, prioritize alternatives
source_quotes: Check how many searches are being made per month for particular keywords

heuristics.name: Competitive Edge Heuristic
heuristics.condition: If keyword competition score is below 80 and search volume exceeds 1000, prioritize for content creation
source_quotes: "Publisher Rocket gives you the competition ranking... zero being low competition"

heuristics.name: Low Review Boost
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are less than 200, prioritize keywords
source_quotes: low content Kindle publishing... isn't too competitive

claims.statement: Amazon ranks keywords by importance: title > subtitle > author > categories > keyword slots
source_quotes: Amazon ranks in that order of importance on your listing

claims.statement: Publisher Rocket operates on a credit-based model rather than monthly subscriptions
source_quotes: "you purchase credits and it gives you a certain amount of searches"

claims.statement: Combining Amazon keyword data with third-party tools like Publisher Rocket creates effective keyword lists for KDP.
source_quotes: combination of amazon itself and a few different extra tools... comprehensive lists

niche_patterns.example: adult coloring book + anxiety + no bleed pages
niche_patterns.description: Target specific audience needs with niche constraints
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Addresses a problem with a unique constraint
source_quotes: Note down keywords that interest you for further research
